headline: Modi Seizes AI Summit to Assert India’s Global Ambitions After Tough Year
summary: Two months into the new year, he’s secured major trade pacts with the European Union and the US, will host several foreign leaders in the coming weeks who want to clinch their own deals, is riding a wave of popular support following key state elections, and his top officials expect economic growth will beat the government’s own forecasts.  This week, Modi will have an opportunity to showcase not only India’s global ambitions but also his own resurgence when he takes the stage at a high profile artificial intelligence summit in New Delhi.  In attendance at the India AI Impact Summit will be more than a dozen heads of state, including from France and Brazil, and some of the most influential leaders in the tech world — from OpenAI’s Sam Altman to Sundar Pichai of Alphabet Inc. to Anthropic PBC’s Dario Amodei.

content.title: Modi Seizes AI Summit to Assert India’s Global Ambitions After Tough Year
content.summary: Two months into the new year, he’s secured major trade pacts with the European Union and the US, will host several foreign leaders in the coming weeks who want to clinch their own deals, is riding a wave of popular support following key state elections, and his top officials expect economic growth will beat the government’s own forecasts.  This week, Modi will have an opportunity to showcase not only India’s global ambitions but also his own resurgence when he takes the stage at a high profile artificial intelligence summit in New Delhi.  In attendance at the India AI Impact Summit will be more than a dozen heads of state, including from France and Brazil, and some of the most influential leaders in the tech world — from OpenAI’s Sam Altman to Sundar Pichai of Alphabet Inc. to Anthropic PBC’s Dario Amodei.

headline: Adani bets $100 billion on data centres to power India’s AI ambitions
summary: Adani Enterprises said on Tuesday that it will invest $100 billion to build renewable-powered AI-ready data centres by 2035, positioning India as ‌a contender in the global AI race.  India has seen a surge in big-ticket AI infrastructure spending, ‌with global players like Google, Amazon, Meta Platforms and Microsoft ramping up investments along with domestic companies such as Reliance and ​TCS.  "AI-ready data centres would be a critical nerve centre of the AI-driven environment and it's natural that large groups with deep pockets will get future-ready by setting up such data centres," said Ambareesh Baliga, an independent market analyst.

content.title: Adani bets $100 billion on data centres to power India’s AI ambitions
content.summary: Adani Enterprises said on Tuesday that it will invest $100 billion to build renewable-powered AI-ready data centres by 2035, positioning India as ‌a contender in the global AI race.  India has seen a surge in big-ticket AI infrastructure spending, ‌with global players like Google, Amazon, Meta Platforms and Microsoft ramping up investments along with domestic companies such as Reliance and ​TCS.  "AI-ready data centres would be a critical nerve centre of the AI-driven environment and it's natural that large groups with deep pockets will get future-ready by setting up such data centres," said Ambareesh Baliga, an independent market analyst.

headline: Tech Weekly: OpenAI unhappy with DeepSeek, Amazon Leo lifts off
summary:
STORY: From OpenAI's DeepSeek frustrations to Amazon's satellite lift-off, this is Tech Weekly.

:: Tech Weekly

OpenAI warned U.S. lawmakers about the actions of Chinese AI startup DeepSeek.

A memo seen by Reuters showed the Sam Altman-led firm believes DeepSeek has tried to replicate U.S. models and use them for their own training.

The technique is known as distillation, where older AI models evaluate the quality of answers coming from a newer model - which effectively transfers the older version's learnings.

DeepSeek and its parent company High-Flyer didn't respond to Reuters' requests for comment.

Russia has completely blocked WhatsApp.

The Kremlin accused the Meta-owned messenger app of not complying with local law.

Moscow suggested Russians should instead turn to a state-backed 'national messenger' called MAX.

But critics argue MAX is a surveillance tool, while Russian authorities deny this.

Britain could ban children under-16 from social media as early as this year.

It could also close a loophole which left some AI chatbots outside safety rules.

It's part of government efforts to respond faster to digital risks.

Spain, Greece and Slovenia have also said they're working on bans after Australia became the first country in the world to block under 16s from social media.

Europe launched its new Ariane 64 heavy-lift rocket.

It carried 32 Amazon Leo satellites with it and sent them into low earth orbit.

it marked the debut of the most powerful version of the Ariane 6 launcher developed by Airbus and Safran joint venture Arianespace.

Amazon Leo is a low Earth orbit satellite network designed to provide internet service to customers beyond the reach of existing terrestrial networks - and could rival SpaceX's Starlink.

And Samsung said it's started to ship its most advanced HBM4 chips to unamed customers.

It's trying to catch up to rivals supplying critical parts for Nvidia AI accelerators.

The global rush to build AI data centers has fueled demand for such chips.

The semiconductors feed massive amounts of data to the accelerators for training and running AI models.

content.title: Tech Weekly: OpenAI unhappy with DeepSeek, Amazon Leo lifts off
content.summary:
STORY: From OpenAI's DeepSeek frustrations to Amazon's satellite lift-off, this is Tech Weekly.

:: Tech Weekly

OpenAI warned U.S. lawmakers about the actions of Chinese AI startup DeepSeek.

A memo seen by Reuters showed the Sam Altman-led firm believes DeepSeek has tried to replicate U.S. models and use them for their own training.

The technique is known as distillation, where older AI models evaluate the quality of answers coming from a newer model - which effectively transfers the older version's learnings.

DeepSeek and its parent company High-Flyer didn't respond to Reuters' requests for comment.

Russia has completely blocked WhatsApp.

The Kremlin accused the Meta-owned messenger app of not complying with local law.

Moscow suggested Russians should instead turn to a state-backed 'national messenger' called MAX.

But critics argue MAX is a surveillance tool, while Russian authorities deny this.

Britain could ban children under-16 from social media as early as this year.

It could also close a loophole which left some AI chatbots outside safety rules.

It's part of government efforts to respond faster to digital risks.

Spain, Greece and Slovenia have also said they're working on bans after Australia became the first country in the world to block under 16s from social media.

Europe launched its new Ariane 64 heavy-lift rocket.

It carried 32 Amazon Leo satellites with it and sent them into low earth orbit.

it marked the debut of the most powerful version of the Ariane 6 launcher developed by Airbus and Safran joint venture Arianespace.

Amazon Leo is a low Earth orbit satellite network designed to provide internet service to customers beyond the reach of existing terrestrial networks - and could rival SpaceX's Starlink.

And Samsung said it's started to ship its most advanced HBM4 chips to unamed customers.

It's trying to catch up to rivals supplying critical parts for Nvidia AI accelerators.

The global rush to build AI data centers has fueled demand for such chips.

The semiconductors feed massive amounts of data to the accelerators for training and running AI models.

headline: Amazon vs. Walmart: Which is capturing the US consumer better?
summary: Walmart (WMT) is riding strong momentum in 2026, surging 20% year-to-date and hitting a $1 trillion market cap. E-commerce giant Amazon (AMZN), on the other hand, is down 14% year-to-date amid mass layoffs. Northwestern Mutual Wealth Management Company CIO Brent Schutte joins Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi and Yahoo Finance senior business reporters Ines Ferré and Brooke DiPalma to break down the battle for US consumers, from groceries to third-party delivery and advertising, and weigh which stock may offer more value in today's market. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Is AWS Worth More Than All Of Amazon?
summary: Of Amazon’s (NASDAQ: AMZN) $717 billion in revenue last year, $128 billion came from AWS. Amazon’s e-commerce business grew at about 8%. The AWS revenue growth was 20%. A more telling number is that, out of Amazon’s $80 billion in operating income, 56% came from AWS. Fundamentally, these are two different businesses. AWS is the ... headline: Retailers That Went Bankrupt During Age Of Amazon

headline: Palantir Is Latest Tech Firm to Move Headquarters to Miami
summary: Miami has been attracting firms and wealthy business executives since the outset of the pandemic drawn by a mix of low taxes, good weather and relatively safe streets.  Since Citadel’s big move in 2022, finance companies and tech companies such as Apple Inc. and Amazon.com Inc. have opened or expanded offices.  ServiceNow Inc. has committed to opening an office in West Palm Beach.

headline: JPMorgan Flags 'AI-Resilient' Software Names After Selloff
summary: Fears that artificial intelligence (AI) will rapidly disrupt software companies have been overdone, according to JPMorgan. The bank’s strategists believe parts of the sector are more resilient than believed, creating a potential opportunity for investors. “Given the positioning flush, overly bearish outlook on AI disruption of software and solid fundamentals, we believe the balance of risks is increasingly skewed towards a rebound,” said Dubravko Lakos‑Bujas, Head of Global Markets Strategy. headline: Adage Capital trims stakes in AI heavyweights
summary: Adage Capital Partners said in its latest filing with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission ‌that it trimmed its investments in some AI heavyweights in ‌the fourth quarter of 2025, while Softbank Group Corp reported it had dissolved its stake ​in Nvidia, a transaction the company first disclosed in November.  Adage disclosed small cuts to stakes in Microsoft , Alphabet and Amazon, as well as Nvidia.  The ⁠Boston-based investment firm did not immediately respond to a request for comment about the changes in its portfolio.

Adage disclosed small cuts to stakes in Microsoft , Alphabet and Amazon, as well as Nvidia.  The ⁠Boston-based investment firm did not immediately respond to a request for comment about the changes in its portfolio.

headline: Outdoor camera, surveillance maker Tactacam explores sale, sources say
summary: The private equity owner of Tactacam is exploring a sale that ‌could value the maker of cameras and surveillance technology ‌for hunters and outdoor enthusiasts at more than $1.5 billion, according to ​people familiar with the matter.  Bertram Capital, which acquired Tactacam in 2023, is working with investment bank JPMorgan on the sale process, which is at an early stage, the sources ‌said.  Bertram and Tactacam did not respond to requests for comment.

Bertram and Tactacam did not respond to requests for comment.

headline: Berkshire Buys New York Times Stock; Sells Apple, Bank of America, Amazon In 4Q
summary: Berkshire Hathaway  continued to trim its stake in  Bank of America  and  Apple  in the fourth quarter and it initiated a new holding in  New York Times  buying five million shares of the newspaper publishing company, according to a 13-F filing after the close of trading Tuesday.  Berkshire also sold most of its holdings in  Amazon  com in the period.  Berkshire reduced its stake in Bank of America by 51 million shares, or about 9%, to 517 million shares, while trimming its interest in Apple by 4%, or 10 million shares, to 227 million.

content.title: Berkshire Buys New York Times Stock; Sells Apple, Bank of America, Amazon In 4Q
content.summary: Berkshire Hathaway  continued to trim its stake in  Bank of America  and  Apple  in the fourth quarter and it initiated a new holding in  New York Times  buying five million shares of the newspaper publishing company, according to a 13-F filing after the close of trading Tuesday.  Berkshire also sold most of its holdings in  Amazon  com in the period.  Berkshire reduced its stake in Bank of America by 51 million shares, or about 9%, to 517 million shares, while trimming its interest in Apple by 4%, or 10 million shares, to 227 million.

headline: Tiger Global, Adage Capital trimmed stakes in AI heavyweights
summary: Tiger Global Management and Adage Capital Partners were among investors that trimmed their holdings of some AI heavyweights including Nvidia and Amazon during the fourth quarter of ‌2025, according to U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission disclosures.  The quarterly 13-F filings provide insight into how some major investors have ‌been reacting to growing worries that valuations of the "Magnificent 7" AI giants -- a cohort that also includes Meta and Microsoft -- have become stretched and that their massive spending ​on AI technology will fail to generate sufficient returns.  Tiger Global trimmed its stake in Microsoft to 5.47 million shares during the fourth quarter from 6.5 million shares as of September 30, 2025.

content.title: Tiger Global, Adage Capital trimmed stakes in AI heavyweights
content.summary: Tiger Global Management and Adage Capital Partners were among investors that trimmed their holdings of some AI heavyweights including Nvidia and Amazon during the fourth quarter of ‌2025, according to U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission disclosures.  The quarterly 13-F filings provide insight into how some major investors have ‌been reacting to growing worries that valuations of the "Magnificent 7" AI giants -- a cohort that also includes Meta and Microsoft -- have become stretched and that their massive spending ​on AI technology will fail to generate sufficient returns.  Tiger Global trimmed its stake in Microsoft to 5.47 million shares during the fourth quarter from 6.5 million shares as of September 30, 2025.
